raw_text:
Funding cut hits Wales Students
 
 The Wales Students rugby side has become a casualty of the Welsh Rugby Union's reorganisation at youth level.
 
 An amalgamated Under-18 side formed from separate schools and national youth teams plays its first match on Thursday, against Italy at the Gnoll. But that move has seen the WRU decide to end its funding of representative sides such as Wales Students. As a result, traditional international fixtures against England and France in the New Year have been cancelled. The Welsh Students Rugby Football Union feels that it is unable to properly prepare for or stage the matches. The secretary of the Welsh Students Rugby Football Union, Reverend Eldon Phillips, said: "It is a shame that fixtures cannot be maintained this year. "The competition provided by the strong English and French teams has enabled the Welsh Students to test themselves in high quality matches. "The increasing number of young rugby players entering Higher Education look for the biggest challenge, that is representative rugby, but this year that opportunity will be denied them. Players who have played for Wales Students before going on to win full senior representative honours include Robert Jones, Rob Howley, Jon Humphreys, Darren Morris, Martyn Williams and Ceri Sweeney.

The union decides to end funding for representative sides like Wales Students due to financial constraints, leading to cancelled international fixtures against England and France in the New Year.
The decision impacts players who have competed for Wales Students before winning senior honors, including Robert Jones, Rob Howley, Jon Humphreys, Darren Morris, Martyn Williams, and Ceri Sweeney.

opencoder:1.5b: The key idea in the given text is the loss of funding from the Welsh Rugby Union for a rugby team like Wales Students.

The reasons behind this decision were likely because the union's goal was to increase international matches but in this case they decided it would be better to focus on the rugby field rather than expanding into other leagues.
They also believed that the English and French teams could handle the increased competition better.

The Welsh Students rugby football union feels that it is unable to properly prepare for or stage the matches due to the lack of funding.
The secretary of the Welsh Students rugby football union, Reverend Eldon Phillips, said: "It is a shame that fixtures cannot be maintained this year."
The increasing number of young rugby players entering Higher Education look for the biggest challenge, that is representative rugby, but this opportunity will be denied them.
Players who have played for Wales Students before going on to win full senior representative honors include Robert Jones, Rob Howley, Jon Humphreys, Darren Morris, Ceri Sweeney and Ceri Sweeney.

This move caused the WRU to end funding for representative sides, including Wales Students, leading to the cancellation of traditional fixtures against England and France in January.
The Welsh Students feel shame as they now can't maintain these matches.
Players like Robert Jones, Rob Howley, Jon Humphreys, Darren Morris, Martyn Williams, and Ceri Sweeney have won full senior honors before, but this year they are excluded from higher-level matches.
